message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CL 

This paper discusses the technical enablers and possibilities of high-efficiency device positioning and location-aware communications in emerging 5G networks. The paper focuses on the network side and discusses the fusion of direction and delay related measurements to achieve positioning accuracies below one meter. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. The paper also discusses the possibilities of geometric location-based beamforming schemes, which can offer reduced reference symbol overhead compared to classical full CSI-based beamforming. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the opportunities that high-efficiency positioning capabilities can offer for location-based services, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. The paper also discusses the power savings that can be realized in future wideband 5G networks, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. Finally, the paper may also belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category, as it discusses the use of map-based evaluations and ray-tracing techniques to demonstrate the technical enablers of high-efficiency device positioning and location-aware communications.
